answers.answer: Well go pay to get a std test done

Well If you're worried about stds,  are you having multiple partners?  If they checked for stds and came out negative you shouldn't worry unless you plan on having unprotected sex with a different partner. And they should have checked for,your cervix I think. Choose another doctor, if,you're,not satisfied,with their performance
I would find another Dr. If I were u because u should get a pap...I nèver heard that before..

I'm 17 and they have me give a urine sample everytime I go to my check up. Idk what they check the urine for but I still have to give my urine sample. I got my pap smear one of the first times I went in and that was it. They are going to start cervical checks for me now every week until the baby comes and I'm 36 weeks now. They are going to do that to see if I'm dialated.
How far along are you? They don't do everything the first visit. They do pap smears during pregnancy.  They usually do them later on.

Ladies lol . I'm in no way concerned about stds . I've been with the same man for 4 years . My problem is the validity of the doctor I'm seeing . I'm just wondering if how shes doing things is standard or if its normal . I'm 17 weeks .
*not normal
It sounds normal to ne. If you are concerned bring it up next visit

Not having a pap smear during pregnancy is normal ? I thought you had to get one ? I'm just worried my doctor isn't doing the things any other doctor would do . But like I said , this is my first pregnancy so I'm just a worried ftm . I just thought routine std checks && a pap smear were the standard for pregnant women . Then again , my friend who has me questioning all this probably gets std checks monthly because of her past history .
If youre under 21 it is no longer medically advised to have a pap smear. They only check once for stds.  You can request them to test you again.
@AOlivia94 Thank you ! That's all I wanted to hear was that my doctor is doing things the normal way lol .

No it's not normal. They do a pap smear early in pregnancy, swab your vagina for cultures and STD play cheek for other things. They only do it once unless something comes back abnormal but they are supposed to check you.

@brianamz97 My doc takes a urine sample at every appointment to check for protein. Protein in urine can be a sign of preeclampsia.@MorganElizabeth18 I'm 20 and the doc saidIin my state they don't do pap smears until you're 21, but she did check my cervix for abnormalities at my first appointment.
Well , I guess every doctor is different but as long as one other lady on here says her doctor does things the same way then my mind is put at ease . Lol thanks ladies !
I Got A Pap Smear At My First Appt, But They Do A Urine Test Every Appt For Stds And Utis.

At your first appt they check for gonnohrea and chlamydia by a urine test. As far as syphillis, HIV, and hepatitis they check for those when they do your blood work. Ive never ever heard of not getting a pap if you are under 21. It is recommended that you get a pap done annually from the time you are sexually active regardless of your age.
Im 19 and they did a pap smear

That's sounds weird. This is my second baby and with my first I had a std and I had a pap smear my first visit that's how they knew. Then I got treated and had another pap smear to make sure everything was clear. With my second pregnancy I had a pap smear with my first visit.
Just look it up. National standard have changed for papsmears. Your doctor is not a "moron"
AOlivia94 that may be true but if you are sexually active you should still get one, your cancer risk is low but your STD risk is highest under 24 years of age
I never got a pap. My dr said sense im under 21 they wont do a pap on me. Its normal. So dont worry. They just checked my cervix at my first drs appt.
They've never checked me internally at all . .
I was 16 when I was preggo with my first and I had got a pap I never knew if you were a certain age they didn't have to do a pap...
They have replaced doing annual /underage papsmears with comprehensive blood tests and urine samples. With these two methods combined, a papsmear is unnecessary.
These standards have been recently changed by the American Medical Association after the findings that in some cases papsmears do more harm than good.
Pap smears don't do any harm, they are just expensive and if they do them annually and find the majority of women have no issues they will change recommendations to less frequently.
Just going by what thousands of credited doctors have come to agree on and none of this is my opinion I copied it from the american medical association website
Def get a new doc! That's ********! They need to check your cervix! Never heard of such a thing.... ??
I got a pap smear when I went it for my first appointment.

An I was still 17 when I first went in. Then I turned 18 a few months later.  An they didn't replace pap smears with blood tests an urine sample lol..  an pap smears aren't harmful. You must have gotten someone that didn't know what they were doing..   idk where you live or if it's different there but here in AZ they still do pap smears no matter what your age... as soon as you start to be sexually active you get a pap smear either twice a yr or once a yr..

Once your 36 weeks you can ask to have your cervix checked... If you don't ask most doctors don't do it. But if you ask they will, the STD thing sounds right to me. And so does the pap smear... My doctor won't do one until I'm 21. I pap smear is different then the swab they do in the beginning of pregnancy

I always got a pap smear the 2nd appt. They check for bv or hpv on your cervix.  I was 16,19 and now 22 and got them each time. They take your pee everytime to check for protiens  in your pee.  I would definately switch to a better gyno that will do a pap.

The only thing a pap smear checks for is cervical cancer. All other STDs and cervical issues can be detected with a blood test, urine test, internal exam, ultrasound etc. The chances of someone under 21 having HPV long enough to cause cancer is very low, so the medical guidelines were changed to reflect that. If you're concerned about a certain issue, talk to your doctor, but trust me, they will check foe everything else even if you don't get a pap smear.

I keep up to date on my annual exams with my provider so when I went in for my first prenatal appointment it was only maybe 5 months since I'd had my last pap... they didn't feel it necessary to do a full exam because they have my records and know my history. If this was your first experience with this provider and they didn't previously provide you with women's health care then I would expect that they'd do a full round of testing to adequately assess any possible risk factors.

question: I was at the doctors && I never received a pap smear so I asked them how they check for std's && problems with your cervix && the nurse told me they check your urine ONCE for stds at your first appointment && they wont check my cervix at all till I'm in labor since I'm 18 . Do any of you ladies know if your doctor checks your urine everytime for stds ? && if you're under 21 did they say they wont check your cervix ? I feel this isn't right . . pregnant or not people contract stds everyday && it can be passed at birth && what if I had something physically wrong with my cervix ? Ugh , first time mom worries .
title: STD/cervix question
